title: Simulation-Based Statistical Inference Education for Understanding p-Values

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: A teaching competency enhancement program for pre-service or in-service teachers. Focuses on applying statistical concepts to practical language analysis for language education majors

learning_goals: Students can accurately explain the probabilistic meaning of p-values using simulation tools with over 80% accuracy.
Students can interpret p-values at a 5% significance level by applying hypothetical probabilistic reasoning in a virtual experimental environment.
Students can explain the concept of p-values to peers using diverse alternative representations (visual graphs, real-life examples).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
